body:
Please try the latest version (0.9.5) as well as the latest nightly release; you can download both from our Github Releases page.

I cannot reproduce this on `master`.

Same issue with nvim 0.9.5.

```
/Users/adoyle/Downloads/nvim-macos/bin/nvim --version
NVIM v0.9.5
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.1692716794
```

```
E5108: Error executing lua [string ":lua"]:1: Vim:Error executing lua callback: ...os/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter
.lua:148: Vim:Error executing lua callback: Vim:E315: ml_get: invalid lnum: 1
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'bufload'
        vim/_editor.lua: in function 'region'
        ...oads/nvim-macos/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/highlight.lua:35: in function 'range'
        ...re/nvim/plugins/nvim-ts-rainbow/lua/rainbow/internal.lua:82: in function 'update_range'
        ...re/nvim/plugins/nvim-ts-rainbow/lua/rainbow/internal.lua:186: in function 'cb'
        ...s/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:746: in function '_do_callback'
        ...s/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:180: in function 'invalidate'
        ...s/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:898: in function '_on_detach'
        ...ads/nvim-macos/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua:73: in function <...ads/nvim-macos/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/trees
itter.lua:69>
        [C]: in function 'nvim_win_close'
        [string ":lua"]:1: in main chunk
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function '__newindex'
        ...os/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:148: in function 'destroy'
        ...os/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:184: in function 'on_detach'
        ...os/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:83: in function 'cb'
        ...s/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:746: in function '_do_callback'
        ...s/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:899: in function '_on_detach'
        ...ads/nvim-macos/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua:73: in function <...ads/nvim-macos/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/trees
itter.lua:69>
        [C]: in function 'nvim_win_close'
        [string ":lua"]:1: in main chunk
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'nvim_win_close'
        [string ":lua"]:1: in main chunk
```

I find the problem. It caused by [nvim-ts-rainbow](https://github.com/p00f/nvim-ts-rainbow).

```
        ...re/nvim/plugins/nvim-ts-rainbow/lua/rainbow/internal.lua:82: in function 'update_range'
        ...re/nvim/plugins/nvim-ts-rainbow/lua/rainbow/internal.lua:186: in function 'cb'
```

When this plugin disabled, no more error printed.

Thank you.
Hmm, `ml_get` errors are internal errors that shouldn't happen, even if a plugin is misbehaving (assume it's not caused by FFI usage). Can you check whether this happens on master?

I can reproduce this on master when unloading a buffer invokes an `on_detach` that calls `bufload` on it. Minimal repro:

```lua
local b = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(true, true)
vim.api.nvim_buf_attach(b, false, {on_detach = function()
  vim.fn.bufload(b)
end})
vim.api.nvim_buf_delete(b, {unload=true})
```

rename.from: When using nvim_win_close, it prints Vim:E315: ml_get: invalid lnum: 1
rename.to: ml_get error when deleting buffer if `on_detach` callback calls `bufload` on it

body:
@seandewar 

For nvim-ts-rainbow, it calls `update_range()` in `on_changedtree`.   `parser:register_cbs({ on_changedtree })`

...oads/nvim-macos/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/highlight.lua:35: in function 'range'
(vim.highlight.range invoked in [this](https://github.com/p00f/nvim-ts-rainbow/blob/master/lua/rainbow/internal.lua#L82-L93).)

...re/nvim/plugins/nvim-ts-rainbow/lua/rainbow/internal.lua:82: in function 'update_range'
(update_range invoked in [this](https://github.com/p00f/nvim-ts-rainbow/blob/master/lua/rainbow/internal.lua#L183-L191))

...re/nvim/plugins/nvim-ts-rainbow/lua/rainbow/internal.lua:186: in function 'cb'
Yup, that's because from an `on_detach` callback, `update_range` calls `vim.highlight.range`, which calls `vim.region`, which calls `bufload()` on the buffer which is being deleted (or unloaded).

rename.to: `ml_get` error when deleting buffer if `on_detach` callback calls `bufload` on it

issue.title: Error in .norg filetype when the plugin is enabled when pressing enter in insert mode

repository.name: ultimate-autopair.nvim
repository.description: A treesitter supported autopairing plugin with extensions, and much more

issue.body:
Recently, I'm encountering an error with Ultimate-autopair.nvim specifically in files with the .norg filetype (The plugin works as expected in other file types). When I enter insert mode and try to press Enter to move to a new line, the following error message appears: 

`Error 10:28:32 PM msg_show.lua_error E315: ml_get: Invalid lnum: 27`

if i try to enter again, a message appears 

`10:28:36 PM msg_show.echo ...autopair.nvim/lua/ultimate-autopair/extension/escape.lua:23: attempt to index field 'line' (a nil value)
stack traceback:
    ...y/ultimate-autopair.nvim/lua/ultimate-autopair/debug.lua:77: in function '__index'
    ...autopair.nvim/lua/ultimate-autopair/extension/escape.lua:23: in function 'filter'
    ...autopair.nvim/lua/ultimate-autopair/extension/escape.lua:36: in function <...autopair.nvim/lua/ultimate-autopair/extension/escape.lua:35>
    [C]: in function 'xpcall'
    ...y/ultimate-autopair.nvim/lua/ultimate-autopair/debug.lua:97: in function 'run'
    ...zy/ultimate-autopair.nvim/lua/ultimate-autopair/core.lua:96: in function <...zy/ultimate-autopair.nvim/lua/ultimate-autopair/core.lua:87>
    [C]: in function 'nvim_eval'
    ....local/share/nvim/lazy/nvim-cmp/lua/cmp/utils/keymap.lua:181: in function 'solve'
    ....local/share/nvim/lazy/nvim-cmp/lua/cmp/utils/keymap.lua:154: in function <....local/share/nvim/lazy/nvim-cmp/lua/cmp/utils/keymap.lua:153>
`

This error occurs only when I press Enter in insert mode to move to a new line in .norg files. Interestingly, pressing Alt+Enter (a default Neorg keybinding) works fine, and I dont encounter any issues with it. 

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open a .norg file.
2. Enter insert mode.
3. Press Enter to create a new line.
4. Observe the error message above.

**Troubleshooting Attempts:**

- I tried disabling autopair for the .norg filetype using the following configuration:

``` lua 
{
  "altermo/ultimate-autopair.nvim",
  event = {
    "InsertEnter",
    "CmdlineEnter"
  },
  opts = {
    extensions = {
      filetype = {
        nft = {
          "TelescopePrompt",
          "Norg"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```
Despite this, the issue persists when Ultimate-autopair.nvim is enabled.

- When I disable Ultimate-autopair.nvim, everything works fine.
- I also have mini.pairs installed through lazyvim which was disabled in favor of ultimate-autopair.nvim. If I enable mini.pairs instead, I dont encounter the error.

**Environment:**

    Neovim version: NVIM v0.10.2
    Ultimate-autopair.nvim version: v0.6 branch

**Additional Context:**
When I searched for the E315 error, I found that it is an internal Vim error related to invalid line numbers, which might indicate an internal issue. Given that the error appears specific to pressing Enter in .norg files, and doesnt occur when mini.pairs is active or when Ultimate-autopair.nvim is disabled, Im unsure if this is an issue with Ultimate-autopair.nvim itself or a conflict in my configuration.

Any guidance or suggestions on resolving this would be greatly appreciated!

issue.title: `ml_get` error if there is `:redrawstatus` inside `on_detach` and tabline accesses buffer-local option of scratch buffer

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
### Problem

Executing `:redrawstatus` inside `on_detach` can lead to `E315: ml_get: Invalid lnum: 1` error in some cases. This, for example, affects doing 'redrawstatus' inside `DiagnosticChanged` callback, as it can be triggered inside [`on_detach` from LSP](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/878b3b89c316138d99f9dbc47c84f2f94591df03/runtime/lua/vim/lsp.lua#L911).

#28084 is possibly related (cc @seandewar), but it shows error while unloading is performed inside `on_detach`. The currently described issue results in an error with `on_detach` only accessing data and not doing any action.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create the following 'init.lua':
    ```lua
    -- Make `on_detach` redraw statusline
    _G.attach_redrawstatus = function()
      local buf_id = vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()
      vim.api.nvim_buf_attach(buf_id, false, {
        on_detach = function()
          -- Using `vim.api.nvim__redraw({ buf = buf_id, statusline = true })`
          -- does not show the error in this particular repro, but in real world
          -- use case still shows several `E315: ml_get: Invalid lnum: 1` errors.
          --
          -- Using `vim.schedule(vim.cmd.redrawstatus)` fixes the issue completely.
          vim.cmd.redrawstatus()
        end,
      })
    end

    -- Set up tabline that accesses buffer-local option of scratch buffer
    local scratch_buf_id = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(false, true)

    _G.make_tabline_string = function()
      -- NOTE: actual option name doesn't seem to matter, i.e. can be 'buftype' or
      -- something else
      local _ = vim.bo[scratch_buf_id].buflisted
      return 'Hello'
    end

    vim.o.tabline = '%!v:lua.make_tabline_string()'
    vim.o.showtabline = 2
    ```
2. `nvim --clean -u init.lua`
3. `:lua attach_redrawstatus()`
4. `:bwipeout`. Should show the `E315: ml_get: Invalid lnum: 1` error.

### Expected behavior

Executing `:redrawstatus` inside `on_detach` does not lead to errors.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1698+gaa976f0d93

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No, doesn't have this functionality

### Operating system/version

EndeavourOS Linux x86_64, 6.12.10-arch1-1

### Terminal name/version

Ghostty 1.1.0-arch

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-ghostty

### Installation

appimage

issue.title: Internal error E38 when redrawing window to unloaded buffer via `on_detach`

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
### Problem

Internal error `E38: Null argument` (and maybe other weirdness) is possible under specific conditions if `nvim_buf_attach`'s `on_detach` callback redraws a window to an unloaded buffer while hlsearch is active.

### Steps to reproduce

```lua
vim.cmd "new | silent! /."
vim.bo.bufhidden = "delete"
vim.api.nvim_buf_attach(0, false, {
  on_detach = function()
    -- Buffer's ml is gone (buf_freeall called), but it's still in a window.
    -- Maybe "on_detach" should have been called before that point...
    assert(vim.fn.bufloaded(vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()) == 0)

    -- This changes the topline from 1 to 0, which dubiously causes win_update
    -- to attempt to draw a win_line when we redraw.
    vim.fn.winrestview(vim.empty_dict())
    vim.cmd "redraw!"
  end,
})
vim.cmd "quit!"
```

The `winrestview` call is needed to screw up the topline so this condition is false:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/bee45fc0e7801396951cd156c82953cbadc256b9/src/nvim/drawscreen.c#L2067

### Expected behavior

No error.

It's a bit dubious that `on_detach` is called inside an unloaded buffer, especially when it's still in a window. (At least it's textlocked )

That said, `nvim_buf_call` can be used to do the same (except the unloaded buffer is shown in the autocmd window); a bit sus, but I couldn't replicate the same issue via that route as `buf_clear_file` sets the `ml_line_count` to 1 before `close_buffer` returns.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

0.12.0-dev-347+gbee45fc0e7

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

N/A

### Terminal name/version

N/A

### $TERM environment variable

N/A

### Installation

Source

body: The `ml_get` error seems to have been fixed by #32403, but the leak remains.

issue.title: fix(api): on_detach consistently before buf_freeall autocmds

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
Problem: on_detach may be called after buf_freeall and other important
things, plus its textlock restrictions are insufficient. This can cause issues
such as leaks, internal errors and crashes.

Solution: disable buffer updates in buf_freeall, before autocommands (like the
order after #35355 and when do_ecmd reloads a buffer). Don't do so in
free_buffer_stuff; it's not safe to run user code there, and buf_freeall already
runs before then; just free them to avoid leaks if buf_freeall autocommands
registered more for some reason.

Fixes #28084
Fixes #33967
Fixes #35116
